Key Match Events: Fernando Tatis Jr. hit a Statcast-tracked home run of at least 445 feet at Dodger Stadium.
Pre-Game Insights: The Padres have already secured their place in the postseason.
The Padres have a shot at capturing a first division title in 18 years.
Padres manager Mike Shildt emphasized the importance of winning each game.
Post-Match Reflections: The Padres will be hoping to get the dominant version of Dylan Cease in the postseason.
Shildt highlighted the team's resilience and their special nature.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Tatis became the first visiting player to hit multiple Statcast-tracked home runs of at least 445 feet at Dodger Stadium.
The game ended with a strikeout to end the ninth inning.
Others: The Padres are left to face the prospect of a best-of-three Wild Card Series next week.
The Padres made baseball history by clinching their postseason spot with a triple play.
